content: Alongside its well-established benefits, amiodarone carries a distinct profile of side effects, particularly with chronic use.9 These include multi-organ toxicities affecting the lungs, liver, thyroid gland, skin, and eyes, as well as proarrhythmic side effects.10 Additionally, its inhibition of various cytochrome P450 (CYP450) enzymes and P-glycoprotein contributes to significant drug interaction risks.8,10

title: The safety profile of amiodarone among older adults (age ≥75 years): A pharmacovigilance study from the FDA data
